title: The Unofficial Index to 40Hex Virus Magazine
historical_context: This article serves as an index for the 40Hex Virus Magazine, which was a significant publication in the early 1990s focusing on computer viruses and hacking culture.
target_audience: Hackers, virus authors, security researchers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
short_summary: This article provides a comprehensive index of all issues of the 40Hex Virus Magazine, detailing the titles and file numbers of various articles related to computer viruses and hacking techniques.
summary: The Unofficial Index to 40Hex Virus Magazine is a meticulously compiled list of articles from the first twelve issues of the magazine, which was published by the virus group Phalcon/SKISM. The index categorizes articles by title, issue number, and file number, making it easier for readers to locate specific content. The magazine itself was known for its focus on virus creation, evasion techniques, and the hacker ethos of the time, providing insights into the underground virus scene of the early 1990s. This index serves as a valuable resource for anyone interested in the history of computer viruses and the hacker community's evolution.
additional_notes: The article reflects the playful yet serious tone of the hacker culture, with references to events and personalities within the community, showcasing the camaraderie and rivalry among virus authors.
